snippet: Cellphone carriers said they responded to 1.3 million demands last year from law enforcement agencies seeking text messages, caller locations and other information on subscribers.
abstract: Cellphone carriers report that they responded to a startling 1.3 million demands for subscriber information in 2011 from law enforcement agencies seeking text messages, caller locations and other information in the course of investigations; report documents an explosion in cellphone surveillance in the last five years, with the companies turning over records thousands of times a day in response to police emergencies, court orders, law enforcement subpoenas and other requests.
lead_paragraph: Cellphone carriers said they responded to 1.3 million demands last year from law enforcement agencies seeking text messages, caller locations and other information on subscribers.

headline.seo: Cell Carriers See Rise in Requests to Aid Surveillance
headline.main: More Demands on Cell Carriers in Surveillance
headline.print_headline: More Demands On Cell Carriers In Surveillance

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
